snippet: Two state legislators facing inquiries into financial wrongdoing lost Democratic primary elections this week, and a third who is accused in a bribery case won by an unexpectedly narrow margin.
abstract: New York Assemblywoman Naomi Rivera of the Bronx and State Senator Shirley L Huntley of Queens, both incumbents, lose in Democratic primaries after being embroiled in scandals in weeks leading up to the election; a third incumbent, Assemblyman William F Boyland Jr of Brooklyn, who is facing federal bribery charges, wins his race, though with less support than some expected.

byline.original: By WINNIE HU and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

lead_paragraph: Two state legislators facing inquiries into financial wrongdoing lost Democratic primary elections this week, and a third who is accused in a bribery case won by an unexpectedly narrow margin.

headline.seo: Scandals Seen as Factor in New York Democratic Legislative Primary Upsets
headline.main: Legislators Tainted by Scandal Find Defeat at the Polls
headline.print_headline: Legislators Tainted by Scandal Find Defeat at the Polls
